et: Middle English {it}abbeye, abbay{/it}, borrowed from Anglo-French {it}abeie, abbaye{/it}, borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}abbātia{/it} "abbacy, abbey," from Late Latin {it}abbāt-, abbās{/it} {et_link|abbot|abbot} + Latin {it}-ia{/it} {et_link|-y:2|-y:2}
shortdef: a monastery ruled by an abbot
a convent ruled by an abbess

dt: Edwin Austin 1852–1911 American painter and illustrator

shortdef: Edwin Austin 1852—1911 American painter and illustrator

dt: 13th century ruins of an abbey founded in 1131 on the Wye River in eastern Wales; subject of a poem by William Wordsworth
